serialization.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SERIALIZATION_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SERIALIZATION_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00009 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1310)
00010 #  pragma warning (disable : 4675) // suppress ADL warning
00011 #endif
00012 
00013 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00014 #include <boost/serialization/strong_typedef.hpp>
00015 #include <boost/serialization/pfto.hpp>
00016 #include <boost/serialization/throw_exception.hpp>
00017 #include <boost/serialization/nvp.hpp>
00018 
00019 // incremented for each "release"
00020 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_LIBRARY_VERSION 19
00021 
00023 // serialization.hpp: interface for serialization system.
00024 
00025 // (C) Copyright 2002 Robert Ramey - http://www.rrsd.com . 
00026 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00027 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00028 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00029 
00030 //  See http://www.boost.org for updates, documentation, and revision history.
00031 
00033 // public interface to serialization. 
00034 
00036 // layer 0 - intrusive verison
00037 // declared and implemented for each user defined class to be serialized
00038 //
00039 //  template<Archive>
00040 //  serialize(Archive &ar, const unsigned int file_version){
00041 //      ar & base_object<base>(*this) & member1 & member2 ... ;
00042 //  }
00043 
00045 // layer 1 - layer that routes member access through the access class.
00046 // this is what permits us to grant access to private class member functions
00047 // by specifying friend class boost::serialization::access
00048 
00049 #include <boost/serialization/access.hpp>
00050 
00052 // layer 2 - default implementation of non-intrusive serialization.
00053 //
00054 // note the usage of function overloading to compensate that C++ does not
00055 // currently support Partial Template Specialization for function templates 
00056 // We have declared the version number as "const unsigned long".  
00057 // Overriding templates for specific data types should declare the version
00058 // number as "const unsigned int". Template matching will first be applied
00059 // to functions with the same version types - that is the overloads.  
00060 // If there is no declared function prototype that matches, the second argument
00061 // will be converted to "const unsigned long" and a match will be made with 
00062 // one of the default template functions below.
00063 
00064 namespace boost {
00065 namespace serialization {
00066 
00067 BOOST_STRONG_TYPEDEF(unsigned int, version_type)
00068 
00069 // default implemenation - call the member function "serialize"
00070 template<class Archive, class T>
00071 inline void serialize(
00072     Archive & ar, T & t, const BOOST_PFTO unsigned int file_version
00073 ){
00074     access::serialize(ar, t, static_cast<unsigned int>(file_version));
00075 }
00076 
00077 // save data required for construction
00078 template<class Archive, class T>
00079 inline void save_construct_data(
00080     Archive & /*ar*/, 
00081     const T * /*t*/, 
00082     const BOOST_PFTO unsigned int /*file_version */
00083 ){
00084     // default is to save no data because default constructor
00085     // requires no arguments.
00086 }
00087 
00088 // load data required for construction and invoke constructor in place
00089 template<class Archive, class T>
00090 inline void load_construct_data(
00091     Archive & ar, 
00092     T * t, 
00093     const BOOST_PFTO unsigned int /*file_version*/
00094 ){
00095     // default just uses the default constructor.  going
00096     // through access permits usage of otherwise private default
00097     // constructor
00098     access::construct(ar, t);
00099 }
00100 
00102 // layer 3 - move call into serialization namespace so that ADL will function
00103 // in the manner we desire.
00104 //
00105 // on compilers which don't implement ADL. only the current namespace
00106 // i.e. boost::serialization will be searched.
00107 // 
00108 // on compilers which DO implement ADL
00109 // serialize overrides can be in any of the following
00110 // 
00111 // 1) same namepace as Archive
00112 // 2) same namespace as T
00113 // 3) boost::serialization
00114 //
00115 // Due to Martin Ecker
00116 
00117 template<class Archive, class T>
00118 inline void serialize_adl(
00119     Archive & ar, 
00120     T & t, 
00121     const unsigned int file_version
00122 ){
00123     // note usage of function overloading to delay final resolution
00124     // until the point of instantiation.  This works around the two-phase
00125     // lookup "feature" which inhibits redefintion of a default function
00126     // template implementation. Due to Robert Ramey
00127     //
00128     // Note that this trick generates problems for compiles which don't support
00129     // PFTO, suppress it here.  As far as we know, there are no compilers
00130     // which fail to support PFTO while supporting two-phase lookup.
00131     #if ! defined(BOOST_NO_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ORDERING)
00132         const version_type v(file_version);
00133         serialize(ar, t, v);
00134     #else
00135         serialize(ar, t, file_version);
00136     #endif
00137 }
00138 
00139 template<class Archive, class T>
00140 inline void save_construct_data_adl(
00141     Archive & ar, 
00142     const T * t, 
00143     const unsigned int file_version
00144 ){
00145     // see above
00146     #if ! defined(BOOST_NO_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ORDERING)
00147         const version_type v(file_version);
00148         save_construct_data(ar, t, v);
00149     #else
00150         save_construct_data(ar, t, file_version);
00151     #endif
00152 }
00153 
00154 template<class Archive, class T>
00155 inline void load_construct_data_adl(
00156     Archive & ar, 
00157     T * t, 
00158     const unsigned int file_version
00159 ){
00160     // see above comment
00161     #if ! defined(BOOST_NO_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ORDERING)
00162         const version_type v(file_version);
00163         load_construct_data(ar, t, v);
00164     #else
00165         load_construct_data(ar, t, file_version);
00166     #endif
00167 }
00168 
00169 } // namespace serialization
00170 } // namespace boost
00171 
00172 #endif //BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SERIALIZATION_HPP
